Mass balance¶

Abstract class outlines the structure of a mass conservation.

Returns the solve parameters.

solve(annotate=True, params=None)[source]¶

Solve the conservation of mass equation for a free-surface evolution.

class mass.UpperFreeSurface(model, thklim=1.0, lump_mass_matrix=False)[source]¶
This class defines the physics and solution to the upper free-surface equation.
\[\frac{\partial S}{\partial t} - u_z + \underline{u} \cdot \nabla S = \Vert \underline{\hat{k}} - \nabla S \Vert \mathring{S}.\]

When the solve() method is executed, something similar to the following output will be displayed:

::: solving free-surface relation :::
mass.S <min, max> : <3.000e-16, 3.000e-16>
Solving nonlinear variational problem.
  Newton iteration 0: r (abs) = 2.750e+12 (tol = 1.000e-10) r (rel) = 1.000e+00 (tol = 1.000e-12)
  Newton iteration 1: r (abs) = 9.595e-04 (tol = 1.000e-10) r (rel) = 3.489e-16 (tol = 1.000e-12)
  Newton solver finished in 1 iterations and 1 linear solver iterations.
mass.S <min, max> : <-1.140e+02, 6.065e+02>
S <min, max> : <1.000e+00, 6.065e+02>

Here,

  • S is the surface height \(S\) saved to model.S
solve(annotate=False)[source]¶

This method solves the free-surface equation for the upper-surface height \(S\), updating self.model.S.

Currently does not support dolfin-adjoint annotation.

solve_dSdt(annotate=False)[source]¶

This method solves the free-surface equation, updating self.model.dSdt.

Currently does not support dolfin-adjoint annotation.

class mass.LowerFreeSurface(model, thklim=1.0, lump_mass_matrix=False)[source]¶
This class defines the physics and solution to the lower free-surface equation.
\[\frac{\partial B}{\partial t} - u_z + \underline{u} \cdot \nabla B = - \Vert \nabla B - \underline{\hat{k}} \Vert \mathring{B}.\]

When the solve() method is executed, something similar to the following output will be displayed:

Here,

  • B is the surface height \(B\) saved to model.B
  • K_source is the tensor corresponding to the source term \(f = u_z - \Vert \nabla B - \underline{\hat{k}} \Vert \mathring{B}\) with lower-surface accumulation/ablation function located (currently) at model.ring_B and vertical velocity \(u_z\).
  • K_advection is the tensor corresponding to the advective part of the free-surface equation \(\underline{u} \cdot \nabla B\)
  • K_stab_u is the tensor corresponding to the streamline/Petrov-Galerkin in stabilization term the direction of velocity located (currently) at model.U3
solve(annotate=False)[source]¶

This method solves the lower free-surface equation for the lower-surface height \(B\), updating self.model.B.

Currently does not support dolfin-adjoint annotation.
